page.title: 19Coalville - the future !
page.content: The North-West Leicestershire Coalfield is nearing the end of its {economic viability.}It is likely that coal will cease to be mined in this area some time during the next decade. The mining industry has been the main employer in this area since the early part of the nineteenth century. Population movement away from the Coalville area seems likely as mines are developed in other regions. If the area is to develop in the future it will need to change. The youth of Coalville do not seem to be optimistic about the future as problems of{unemployment}dominate nationally. It remains to be seen how the area can regenerate itself and in what ways the Dictrict Council can seek to attract both industry and inhabitants.
